verses.kjv: And of the blue, and purple, and scarlet, they made cloths of service, to do service in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: Of the blue, purple, and scarlet, they made finely worked garments for ministering in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Using blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, the craftsmen made the finely woven garments for serving in the holy place. They also made the sacred garments for Aaron, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And he made the ephod of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
verses.web: He made the ephod of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.
verses.ct: They made the ephod from gold thread, blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely twisted linen.

verses.kjv: And they did beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, with cunning work.
verses.web: They beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in with the blue, the purple, the scarlet, and the fine linen, the work of the skillful workman.
verses.ct: They hammered gold into thin sheets, then cut it into narrow threads so it could be woven into the blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and the fine linen — all of it expertly crafted.

verses.kjv: They made shoulderpieces for it, to couple it together: by the two edges was it coupled together.
verses.web: They made shoulder straps for it, joined together. It was joined together at the two ends.
verses.ct: They made shoulder straps for the ephod, attaching them so the piece was joined together at its two edges.

verses.kjv: And the curious girdle of his ephod, that was upon it, was of the same, according to the work thereof; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: The skillfully woven band that was on it, with which to fasten it on, was of the same piece, like its work: of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: The decorative waistband was made from the same materials and crafted as one piece with the ephod — gold thread, blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely twisted linen — just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And they wrought onyx stones inclosed in ouches of gold, graven, as signets are graven, with the names of the children of Israel.
verses.web: They worked the onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold, engraved with the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: They prepared the onyx stones by setting them in gold frames and engraving them like a seal with the names of the sons of Israel.

verses.kjv: And he put them on the shoulders of the ephod, that they should be stones for a memorial to the children of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: He put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Then they mounted the stones on the shoulder straps of the ephod as reminders of the sons of Israel, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And he made the breastplate of cunning work, like the work of the ephod; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
verses.web: He made the breastplate, the work of a skillful workman, like the work of the ephod: of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.
verses.ct: They made the breastplate with the same expert skill used on the ephod, using gold thread, blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely twisted linen.

verses.kjv: It was foursquare; they made the breastplate double: a span was the length thereof, and a span the breadth thereof, being doubled.
verses.web: It was square. They made the breastplate double. Its length was a span, and its width a span, being double.
verses.ct: It was square and folded double, measuring 1 span long and 1 span wide when folded.

verses.kjv: And they set in it four rows of stones: the first row was a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: this was the first row.
verses.web: They set in it four rows of stones. A row of ruby, topaz, and beryl was the first row;
verses.ct: They mounted 4 rows of gemstones on it. The first row held a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle.

verses.kjv: And the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
verses.web: and the second row, a turquoise, a sapphire, and an emerald;
verses.ct: The second row held an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.

verses.kjv: And the third row, a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
verses.web: and the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
verses.ct: The third row held a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.

verses.kjv: And the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper: they were inclosed in ouches of gold in their inclosings.
verses.web: and the fourth row, a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper. They were enclosed in gold settings.
verses.ct: The fourth row held a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. Each stone was set in a gold frame.

verses.kjv: And the stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet, every one with his name, according to the twelve tribes.
verses.web: The stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names; like the engravings of a signet, everyone according to his name, for the twelve tribes.
verses.ct: There were 12 stones in all, one for each of the 12 tribes of Israel. Each stone was engraved like a seal with the name of its tribe.

verses.kjv: And they made upon the breastplate chains at the ends, of wreathen work of pure gold.
verses.web: They made on the breastplate chains like cords, of braided work of pure gold.
verses.ct: For the breastplate, they made braided chains of pure gold, twisted like cords.

verses.kjv: And they made two ouches of gold, and two gold rings; and put the two rings in the two ends of the breastplate.
verses.web: They made two settings of gold, and two gold rings, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
verses.ct: They also made 2 gold settings and 2 gold rings, and attached the rings to the top 2 corners of the breastplate.

verses.kjv: And they put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings on the ends of the breastplate.
verses.web: They put the two braided chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate.
verses.ct: They fastened the 2 braided gold chains to the rings at the top corners of the breastplate.

verses.kjv: And the two ends of the two wreathen chains they fastened in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulderpieces of the ephod, before it.
verses.web: The other two ends of the two braided chains they put on the two settings, and put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, in its front.
verses.ct: The other ends of the 2 chains were attached to the gold settings, which were then secured to the front of the ephod's shoulder straps.

verses.kjv: And they made two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, upon the border of it, which was on the side of the ephod inward.
verses.web: They made two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on its edge, which was toward the side of the ephod inward.
verses.ct: They made 2 more gold rings and attached them to the bottom 2 corners of the breastplate, on the inner edge that faced the ephod.

verses.kjv: And they made two other golden rings, and put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, toward the forepart of it, over against the other coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod.
verses.web: They made two more rings of gold, and put them on the two shoulder straps of the ephod underneath, in its front, close by its coupling, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.ct: They made yet another pair of gold rings and attached them to the lower front of the ephod's shoulder straps, near the seam and just above the decorative waistband.

verses.kjv: And they did bind the breastplate by his rings unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not be loosed from the ephod; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: They bound the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not come loose from the ephod, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Then they tied the breastplate's lower rings to the ephod's rings with a blue cord, keeping it snug against the waistband so the breastplate wouldn't swing loose from the ephod — just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And he made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue.
verses.web: He made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue.
verses.ct: They made the robe that goes under the ephod entirely from woven blue fabric.

verses.kjv: And there was an hole in the midst of the robe, as the hole of an habergeon, with a band round about the hole, that it should not rend.
verses.web: The opening of the robe in the middle of it was like the opening of a coat of mail, with a binding around its opening, that it should not be torn.
verses.ct: It had an opening at the center for the head, reinforced with a woven collar around the edge so it wouldn't tear.

verses.kjv: And they made upon the hems of the robe pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen.
verses.web: They made on the skirts of the robe pomegranates of blue, purple, scarlet, and twined linen.
verses.ct: Along the bottom hem of the robe, they attached pomegranates made of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and twisted linen.

verses.kjv: And they made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the hem of the robe, round about between the pomegranates;
verses.web: They made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates around the skirts of the robe, between the pomegranates;
verses.ct: They also made bells of pure gold and placed them between the pomegranates all around the hem of the robe.

verses.kjv: A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, round about the hem of the robe to minister in; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, around the skirts of the robe, to minister in, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: The pattern alternated — a bell, then a pomegranate, a bell, then a pomegranate — all the way around the hem of the robe worn for ministry, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And they made coats of fine linen of woven work for Aaron, and for his sons,
verses.web: They made the tunics of fine linen of woven work for Aaron and for his sons,
verses.ct: They made tunics of finely woven linen for Aaron and his sons.

verses.kjv: And a mitre of fine linen, and goodly bonnets of fine linen, and linen breeches of fine twined linen,
verses.web: the turban of fine linen, the linen headbands of fine linen, the linen trousers of fine twined linen,
verses.ct: They also made the turban of fine linen, the decorative headbands of fine linen, and the undergarments of finely twisted linen.

verses.kjv: And a girdle of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, of needlework; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: the sash of fine twined linen, blue, purple, and scarlet, the work of the embroiderer, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: The sash was made of finely twisted linen with blue, purple, and scarlet embroidery — just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And they made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote upon it a writing, like to the engravings of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
verses.web: They made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote on it an inscription, like the engravings of a signet: “HOLY TO YAHWEH”.
verses.ct: They made the medallion for the sacred crown out of pure gold and engraved it like a seal with the words: "HOLY TO THE LORD."

verses.kjv: And they tied unto it a lace of blue, to fasten it on high upon the mitre; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: They tied to it a lace of blue, to fasten it on the turban above, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: They fastened it to the front of the turban with a blue cord, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: Thus was all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation finished: and the children of Israel did according to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so did they.
verses.web: Thus all the work of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting was finished. The children of Israel did according to all that LORD commanded Moses; so they did.
verses.ct: With that, all the work on the tabernacle — the Tent of Meeting — was complete. The people of Israel had done everything exactly as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And they brought the tabernacle unto Moses, the tent, and all his furniture, his taches, his boards, his bars, and his pillars, and his sockets,
verses.web: They brought the tabernacle to Moses: the tent, with all its furniture, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets,
verses.ct: Then they brought everything to Moses: the tabernacle tent with all its furnishings — the clasps, frames, crossbars, posts, and bases;

verses.kjv: And the covering of rams’ skins dyed red, and the covering of badgers’ skins, and the vail of the covering,
verses.web: the covering of rams’ skins dyed red, the covering of sea cow hides, the veil of the screen,
verses.ct: the outer covering of rams' skins dyed red, the covering of fine leather, and the inner curtain;

verses.kjv: The ark of the testimony, and the staves thereof, and the mercy seat,
verses.web: the ark of the covenant with its poles, the mercy seat,
verses.ct: the ark of the testimony with its carrying poles and the mercy seat;

verses.kjv: The table, and all the vessels thereof, and the shewbread,
verses.web: the table, all its vessels, the show bread,
verses.ct: the table with all its utensils and the bread of the Presence;

verses.kjv: The pure candlestick, with the lamps thereof, even with the lamps to be set in order, and all the vessels thereof, and the oil for light,
verses.web: the pure lamp stand, its lamps, even the lamps to be set in order, all its vessels, the oil for the light,
verses.ct: the pure gold lampstand with its lamps arranged in order, all its accessories, and the oil for lighting;

verses.kjv: And the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the tabernacle door,
verses.web: the golden altar, the anointing oil, the sweet incense, the screen for the door of the Tent,
verses.ct: the gold altar, the anointing oil, the fragrant incense, and the curtain for the entrance of the tabernacle;

verses.kjv: The brasen altar, and his grate of brass, his staves, and all his vessels, the laver and his foot,
verses.web: the bronze altar, its grating of bronze, its poles, all of its vessels, the basin and its base,
verses.ct: the bronze altar with its bronze grating, its carrying poles, and all its utensils; the basin and its stand;

verses.kjv: The hangings of the court, his pillars, and his sockets, and the hanging for the court gate, his cords, and his pins, and all the vessels of the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of the congregation,
verses.web: the hangings of the court, its pillars, its sockets, the screen for the gate of the court, its cords, its pins, and all the instruments of the service of the tabernacle, for the Tent of Meeting,
verses.ct: the curtains for the courtyard with their posts and bases, the screen for the courtyard entrance, its ropes and tent pegs, and every piece of equipment used in the service of the tabernacle — the Tent of Meeting;

verses.kjv: The cloths of service to do service in the holy place, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and his sons’ garments, to minister in the priest’s office.
verses.web: the finely worked garments for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest’s office.
verses.ct: the finely crafted garments for serving in the holy place, the sacred garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments for his sons to wear while serving as priests.

verses.kjv: According to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel made all the work.
verses.web: According to all that LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did all the work.
verses.ct: The people of Israel had completed every part of the work exactly as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And Moses did look upon all the work, and, behold, they had done it as the LORD had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.
verses.web: Moses saw all the work, and behold, they had done it as LORD had commanded. They had done so; and Moses blessed them.
verses.ct: Moses inspected all the work, and sure enough, they had done it precisely as the LORD had instructed. So Moses blessed them.
